content: marker 72 stitches remain decrease round 4 knit all stitches decrease round 5 *k4 k2tog* repeat to marker 60 stitches remain decrease round 6 knit all stitches decrease round 7 switch to dpns *k3 k2tog* repeat to marker 48 stitches remain decrease round 8 *k2 k2tog* repeat to marker 36 stitches remain decrease round 9 *k1 k2tog* repeat to marker 24 stitches remain decrease round 10 k2tog around 12 stitches remain finishing cut white yarn and thread onto tapestry needle thread through remaining stitches twice then remove knitting needles and pull tight to close the opening take yarn to inside and weave in end weave in all remaining ends wet or steam block if adding a tri-color pom pom wrap the yarn for your pom using all three colors at one trim the pom and sew to the top of the hat notes us 3 / 3 25mm needles were used for the brim to make the ribbing as tidy and snug as possible as knit the folded brim fits a 22 5 head circumference comfortably but snugly if knitting for a larger head circumference or if a looser fit is desired consider using us 4/3 5mm or us 5/3 75mm 16 circular needle for the ribbed brim can of worms knitting blocky letters is an excellent occasion to try ladderback jacquard knitting as a way of handling long floats a thorough explanation and related support is beyond the scope of this free pattern but ysolda teague s tutorial on lbj is here https
